post.description: Checkout Sessions allow you to create one-off payments in a fixed or variable amount or start subscriptions for your customers. You should create a new Checkout Session for each payment attempt. Once you create a Checkout Session on your server, you need to redirect user to the Checkout Session URL to complete the payment flow.

mode.description: The mode of the Checkout Session.

customerId.description: The ID of the customer if you want to associate the session with a customer

clientReferenceId.description: Unique ID string used to identify the session in your backend. This can be your payment ID, cart ID, or similar used to link this Checkout Session with your internal system.

customerCreation.description: Whether to create a customer for the session. If required, a customer will be created for subsequent payments

customerUpdate.description: The customer update settings to use for this checkout to update existing customer details

submitType.description: The type of submit button to display on the Checkout page

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a Checkout Session object

billingAddressCollection.description: Whether to collect the customer's billing address. Default: false

expiresAt.description: The time at which the session will expire. Default: 1 Hour

successUrl.description: The URL to redirect the customer to after payment is completed. Only applicable when `afterCompletion` is set to `redirect`

cancelUrl.description: The URL to redirect the customer to if they decide to cancel payment

post.description: Create a payment link to accept payments from customers. You can accept payments in a fixed or variable amount from your customers. Whether you are doing a freelancing, running a crowdfunding campaign, accept donations, or just looking for a simple way to build patrons via crypto, these payment links are the perfect solution.

code.description: The customer-facing code. Regardless of case, this code must be unique across all active promotion codes for each customer.

couponId.description: Coupon id

isActive.description: Whether the promotion code is currently active. A promotion code is only active if the coupon is also enabled.

expiredAt.description: Date at which the promotion code can no longer be redeemed. If the coupon has specified a redeems_by, then this value cannot be after the coupons redeems_by.

maxRedemptions.description: Maximum number of times this promotion code can be redeemed. If the coupon has specified a max_redemptions, then this value cannot be greater than the coupons max_redemptions.

createdAt.description: Date at which the promotion code was created

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

name.description: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on for instance invoices or receipts.

percentOff.description: Percent that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer for the duration of the coupon.

maxRedemptions.description: Maximum number of times this coupon can be redeemed, in total, across all customers, before it is no longer valid.

redeemBy.description: Date after which the coupon can no longer be redeemed

isEnable.description: Taking account of the above properties, whether this coupon can still be applied to a customer.

createdAt.description: Time at which this coupon was created.
